en: The Mariana trench is the deepest part of our planet - deeper than the height of mount Everest.
The winter of 1932 was so cold that Niagara Falls froze over completely.
70% of Earth is covered by oceans. The remaining 30% is solid ground, rising above sea level.
The average ice berg weighs 20,000,000 tons.
Asian Continent covers 30% of the total earth land area.
When Columbus "discovered" the Americas, the continent was already inhabited by 90 mln people which was a third of the world's population.
The land of Antarctica is not owned by any country.
Hawaii was originally called the Sandwich Islands.
Global warming may affect the Maldives, because this country is below sea level by 1.8 m.
The first place in the world to allow women to vote New Zealand.
Istanbul, Turkey is the only city in the world to be located in two continents.
Only 3% water of the earth is fresh, rest 97% salted.
The eruption of Krakatoa in 1883 was the loudest sound in recorded history, heard 3,000 miles (4800 KM) away.
Longest officially recognized place name is Taumatawhakatangihangakoauauotamateapokaiwhenuakitanatahu.
Montana borders the most Canadian Provinces of all the fifty states. It borders three of them.
The Niagara Falls moves upstream at an average rate of about 1 ft a century!
What we call the sky is merely the limit of our vision into the atmosphere. The sky, like the horizon, is always as far away as one can see.
At their closest point, the Russian and U.S. borders are less than two miles apart.
Mexico City is built on top of an underground resevoir!
Of the 3,000 islands in the Bahama chain in the Caribbean, only 20 are inhabited.
The Hawaiian Islands are the projecting tops of the biggest mountain range in the world.
The country of Losotho is completely surrounded by the country of South Africa.
The largest man-made lake in the U.S. is Lake Mead, created by Hoover Dam.
The Pacific Ocean holds 46% of the worlds water. The rest is divided up as followed: Atlantic Ocean  23.9%, Indian Ocean  20.3%, and the Arctic Ocean  3.7%.
The deepest part of the ocean is 35,813 feet (10,916 meters) deep and occurs in the Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean.
Did you know Jamaica has 120 rivers?
Did you know the moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days?
The largest diamond that was ever found was 3106 carats.
All the gold ever mined could be molded into a cube 60 feet high and 60 feet wide.

The Leaning Tower of Pisa was built on the site of a river estuary. The land under the town has several layers of silt and soft clay. The 15,000-ton tower tilts to the south because the subsoil is too unstable.

Charles Lindbergh was not the first man to fly the Atlantic. He was the sixty-seventh. The first sixty-six made the crossing in dirigibles and twin-engine mail planes. Lindbergh was the first to make the dangerous flight alone.
With the exception of Antarctica, all continents are wider in the north than in the south.
The Tonle Sap River in Cambodia flows north for almost half the year and then south for the rest of the year.
The volume of water in the Amazon river is greater than the next eight largest rivers in the world combined.
All the platinum ever mined would fit into an average-sized living-room!
The largest gold nugget ever found weighed 172 lbs., 13 oz.
The most remote island in the world is Tristan da Cunha, which is above the sub-Antarctic zone.
The earliest dinosaur found was Eoraptor, which lived 230 million years ago in what is now Argentina.
Mount St. Helens dropped 1,313 feet in 1980.
The Leaning Tower of Pisa is predicted to topple over between 2010 and 2020.
If the Earth was smooth, the ocean would cover the entire surface to a depth of 12,000 feet.
The Big Room at Carlsbad Caverns in New Mexico is 2,500 feet in length, 600 feet wide, and 250 feet high.
The Santa Maria was the only one of Columbus's ships not to return to Spain. It hit a reef on December 5, 1492 and sank.
El Capitan in Yosemite National Park is the largest visible granite rock in the world. It's twice the size of the Rock of Gibraltar.
There's a lake under Antarctica that is 25 million years old called Lake Vostok.
The Hudson River along the island of Manhattan flows in either direction depending upon the tide.
The whirling cloud, a flat cloud hovering over the peak of an extinct volcano, Mount Jirinaj in Indonesia, affected by hot air rising from the crater, spins swiftly around and around.
